intro: Acourtia huajuapana var. actinomorpha, commonly known as the Huajuapán acourtia, is a rare and endemic plant species found in the highlands of central Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and leafy basal rosettes. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at elevations above 2,500 meters. Its flowers are yellow to orange in color, and it produces small, oblong fruits that contain a single seed. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species.
